name: Hotel L'Esplanade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: L'Esplanade is a gorgeous boutique hotel, but the service is less than savory. Any time we called the front desk to ask a question, the person who picked up (one of them being Philomena, a manager), seemed as if we were inconveniencing them. They were curt and unfriendly. There was another young lady who checked us in, and she was far from welcoming. We expected her to tell us more about the hotel and surrounding area; unfortunately she seemed disinterested and lazy. Hopefully this review will change their negative attitude.
reviews.title: Alain is the friendliest person at L'Esplanade
Heavenly Vacation
reviews.text: I must note that there was one man that brought our bags to our room and was extremely helpful and enthusiastic that we were staying with L'Esplanade. And Alain, the bartender at the pool, was the friendliest person at the hotel. He took the time to talk to us, tell us about St. Martin, and made some amazing drinks to boot! The housekeeping was excellent. Our room was always impeccably clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, just a short walk away from restaurant row. Stand outs for us were L'Hibiscus and Spiga. Definitely grab some BBQ at one of the Lolos, and watch the sunset at Calmos Cafe.
reviews.title: Perfectly Quaint

likes.liked: — Everything, service, room, pool, access to beach
likes.disliked: — Be prepared to walk a half mile to the restaurants, as parking is difficult

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Make sure you bring lots of cash -- there are VERY FEW ATMs on the island, and the one closest to the hotel was broken.
reviews.title: Top Shelf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say, i was a little worried booking it myself versus a travel agent, but from the beginning the staff was warm and accomendating. They even booked all our dinner reservations for us which were perfect. Upon arriving no hassel warm and welcoming to us took us directly to our room which was gorgeous just like the pictures a welcome basket with bread, cookies, coffee tea and a bottle of champagne. This was the first vacation that I never had to call the desk to complain that there was a problem. The maid service was the best I have ever had and I travel alot. The view is to die for every morning with my coffee out on the balcony and looking at the view puts you in the best of moods for the whole day. We met the owners at a welcome party an they are lovely. We tried this versus a big name hotel and it was perfect. Quiet, stressfree vacation. i will return again and tell everyone how great this trip was.
reviews.title: Confirming What You Already Know...

reviews.text: This is a LOVELY small hotel tucked in the hills of Grand Case with panoramic views of the ocean. The hotel feels very private and makes you forget you're staying on the very busy island of St. Maarten/St. Martin. The landscaping is beautiful. L'Esplanade and its staff lived up to all the great reviews we had read.
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.text: ROOM: We stayed in a spacious Deluxe Studio. It had a King bed, a small dining table with 4 chairs and a kitchenette with a large fridge, an oven, a microwave and dinnerware/cookware. The room also had a DVD player, a CD player and a small safe (you would not be able to fit a laptop). If you need a voltage converter, the front desk will lend you one at no charge. We had a lovely ocean view and we could see the Grand Case airport runway to the left. We did not think the airplane noise was intrusive. Only small planes use that airport and only during daylight.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.text: BEACH: L'Esplanade is not on the beach. There's a footpath that will take you either to Grand Case Beach or Petite Plage. It is a 5-10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Loved the Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: POOLS: The main pool has a swim-up bar. You can order drinks and food from 11am-6pm every day. There's a small round wading pool.
reviews.title: Diamond in the Isle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD: We tried the cheeseburgers with fries, the chicken salad and the chicken sandwich. The morning of our departure, we ordered a baguette, croissants, pain au chocolat and pain au raisin for breakfast. All of the food was very good.
reviews.title: a perfect getaway
Exceeded our expectations!
reviews.text: This was our best trip yet, having been to St. Bart's the last two yeaars. I expected not to like St. Martin but after two weeks, I feel as if we have found our home away from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much of our satisfaction is due to L'Esplanade and I would highly recommend it. The staff was so attentive and kind, always goiing beyond the call of duty. The weekly cocktail party held by the pool was an excellent way to get to know other guests. We ran into old friends and found out that this was their 12th year at L'Esplanade!
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect stay - not sure if the Island is worth the hype

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Lespalanade was an extremely well run hotel. The rooms were spacious (we only had a studio), extremely clean (especially for a beach area hotel), overly friendly staff (arranged a rental car and sailing excursion for us), and immaculately maintained grounds. The bed was comfortable, furnishings tasteful, a nice balcony. The hotel itself looks really cool in how it blends in with the side of a mountain. The pool bar is nicely setup and the bartender makes some great drinks. I also liked how the hotel was set "above" from the town. You felt like you could walk to the center of things, but it was extremely quiet at night.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

likes.disliked: — Pool water temp and French style showers

reviews.text: If I had to give only one complaint, it was that compared to other resorts, I thought the hotel was expensive for the amenities offered - i.e. during high season we paid $330/night + $35/day "service" charge + tax - which isn't an unheard of rate - but there is no big pool or attached beach or workout center or free breakfast or even a restaurant attached. The pool, while nicely kept is tiny - and everything else involves paying more money to other parties (beach chairs at the Grand Case Beach club, money to use the gym down the street, money for continental breakfast to be delivered from a bakery, etc). I'm not really sure how this won a "Best Bargin" award. If you are looking for a resort type hotel, this definately does not qualify - it would fit under the category of small boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Quaint, Renovated and Very Clean

likes.liked: — Hotel was beautiful, comfortable, clean and convenient walking distance from Grand Case

reviews.text: As for St. Martin /St. Marteen itself, I agree with the other reviewers that I found the place interesting, but not sure I'd return unless I had a really good deal. We did the America's Cup sailing excursion one day, which was a ton of fun - though Phillipburg (where the ships depart from) seemed like a town entirely based around cruise ship tourists. We rented a car (an absolute must to really enjoy the Island) and visited both Friars Bay, Orient, and Dawn Beach - all really nice areas. We had breakfast every day at Sunset Cafe at GCBC and dinner at Spiga, LeEscapade, and Bistro Caribes in Grand Case. All three were great meals (only the first two offered 1:1 on currency conversions). Spiga was probably the highest quality food. We had late night drinks at Zen It and Calmos Cafe, both small and laid back, but fun.
reviews.title: Spectacular villa at L'Esplanade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't want to repeat what's already been said so I'll just give you a few highlights.
reviews.title: Good Times

likes.disliked: — our room was noisy because of people above us

reviews.text: It's a great little hotel with excelent service. We stayed in a delux loft the first 3 nights which was fantastic. The loft was not renovated as the suites are but it was huge, with 2 decks, a beautiful mohogany staircase and very quiet. We then switched to a one bedroom suite. We knew we would have to do this when we booked the room and we were excited to see 2 different styles of rooms. The suite was renovated so it was very nice but we ended up liking the loft better because the suite was noisy due to the people above us. I THINK this was one off because we talked to other guests that had people above them and they had no issues.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but WAY overpriced

likes.disliked: — The price, the lack of Internet, the incorrect breakfast order, the lack of beach chairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one thing I wanted to say because I think it's been understated on these reviews is: I loved St Martin. Here's why
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and vacation

likes.liked: — Accomodations were immaculate, bartender at pool bar was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Good weather- don't look on weather.com like I did. It will say showers everyday which is true but irrelevent. Most of the time you will have sunshine and trade winds with some clouds mixed in.enjoy
reviews.title: Could not be better!

likes.liked: — Overall quality and care shown by everyone there. Great web site.Wonsder
likes.disliked: — Can't come up with a thing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Great Beaches- see as many as you can. We liked orient when there weren't a lot of cruise ships(gets crowded) and friars. Ocean is amazing. perfect temp. amazing color and even has waves at certain places. Note- avoid the nude beach on Orient as our taxi driver J.R. said, "no one that should be naked has ever been seen naked on that beach".
reviews.title: Great hotel!

description: Amid lush tropical gardens, affording its visitors privacy without sacrificing its panoramic ocean views. Spacious interiors blend harmoniously with the Mediterranean architecture. Magical sunsets come to you on your private terrace to touch your soul. A delightful footpath leads you on a journey of discovery. We invite you to find your own rhythm, knowing that our staff is there to ensure that your every day is a perfect day, knowing that your comfort is our excellence and with us, you are home. For those who appreciate privacy, enjoy an uncrowded atmosphere, gracious hospitality and seek relaxation in exclusive, blissful surroundings... welcome to Hotel L'Esplanade.
